edu.washington.cs.cse490h.lib
Class Emulator

java.lang.Object
  edu.washington.cs.cse490h.lib.Manager
      edu.washington.cs.cse490h.lib.Emulator

public class Emulator
extends Manager

Manager that runs under a single emulated node on the client machine.

Constructor Detail

Emulator

public Emulator(java.lang.Class<? extends Node> nodeImpl,
                java.lang.String routerName,
                int routerPort,
                java.lang.Long seed,
                long timeStep,
                java.lang.String replayOutputFilename,
                java.lang.String replayInputFilename)
         throws java.io.IOException,
                java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Base constructor for the Emulator. Does most of the work, but the command input method and failure level should be set before calling this constructor.

Parameters:
nodeImpl - The Class object for the student's node implementation
routerName - The name of the machine on which the router is running
routerPort - The port on which the router listens
seed - Seed for the random number generator. Can be null to use the current time as a seed
timeStep - The number of milliseconds to wait between rounds
replayOutputFilename - The log file for future relays of the current execution
replayInputFilename - The log file to replay
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the arguments provided to the program are invalid
java.io.IOException - If creating the user input reader fails

Emulator

public Emulator(java.lang.Class<? extends Node> nodeImpl,
                java.lang.String routerName,
                int routerPort,
                Manager.FailureLvl failureGen,
                java.lang.Long seed,
                long timeStep,
                java.lang.String replayOutputFilename,
                java.lang.String replayInputFilename)
         throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                java.io.IOException,
                java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Create a new emulator that takes commands through user input

Parameters:
nodeImpl - The Class object for the student's node implementation
routerName - Name of the machine that the Router is on
routerPort - The port that the Router is listening on
failureGen - How failures should be generated
seed - Seed for the RNG. This can be null if the failure generator is not a RNG
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException - If the router's name cannot be resolved
java.io.IOException - If there is an error in writing to the TCP socket
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the local port given is already in use

Emulator

public Emulator(java.lang.Class<? extends Node> nodeImpl,
                java.lang.String routerName,
                int routerPort,
                Manager.FailureLvl failureGen,
                java.lang.Long seed,
                long timeStep,
                java.lang.String replayOutputFilename,
                java.lang.String replayInputFilename,
                java.lang.String commandFile)
         throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                java.io.IOException,
                java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Create a new emulator that takes commands through a file

Parameters:
nodeImpl - The Class object for the student's node implementation
routerName - Name of the machine that the Router is on
routerPort - The port that the Router is listening on
failureGen - How failures should be generated
commandFile - File containing the list of commands
seed - Seed for the RNG. This can be null if the failure generator is not a RNG
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException - If the router's name cannot be resolved
java.io.IOException - If there is an error in writing to the TCP socket
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the local port given is already in use
Method Detail

start

protected void start()
Starts the emulated node

Specified by:
start in class Manager

stop

protected void stop()
Description copied from class: Manager
Stops MessageLayer. This method should not return

Overrides:
stop in class Manager

startNode

private void startNode()
Start up a node, crashed or brand new. If the node is alive, this method will crash it first.

failNode

private Node.NodeCrashException failNode()
Fail the node. This attempts to kill both the node/its saved state, and the server.

Returns:
The exception thrown after calling the fail() method. This is so, if the stack includes methods in Node, we can rethrow the Exception as necessary

killNode

private Node.NodeCrashException killNode()
Kill the node and its associated data structures.

Returns:
The exception thrown after calling the fail() method. See failNode() for why this happens

killServer

private void killServer()
Kill the NodeServer and get rid of the in transit messages.

                               java.lang.String description)
Description copied from class: Manager
Check if we should crash before a write.

Specified by:
checkWriteCrash in class Manager
Parameters:
n - The node that is trying to write to the disc.
description - The description of the write so the user knows what caused the crash

executeEvents

private void executeEvents(java.util.ArrayList<Event> currentRoundEvents)
Reorders and executes all the events for the current round. Note that commands can be executed in a different order than they appear in the command file!

Parameters:
currentRoundEvents - The list of the current round's events that we should add to

handleEvent

private void handleEvent(Event ev)
Process an event.

Parameters:
ev - The event that should be processed

sendPkt

protected void sendPkt(Node fromNode,
                       int to,
                       int protocol,
                       byte[] payload)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Create a packet and put it on the channel. Crashes in the middle of a broadcast can be modeled by a post-send crash, plus a sequence of dropped messages

Overrides:
sendPkt in class Manager
Parameters:
fromNode - The node that is sending the packet
to - Integer specifying the destination node
protocol - The protocol of the message
payload - The payload to be sent, serialized to a byte array
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the send is invalid

sendToRouter

private void sendToRouter(int destAddr,
                          byte[] pkt)
Send a packet off to the router.

Parameters:
destAddr - The virtual address of the destination
pkt - The serialized version of the Packet to be sent

deliverPkt

private void deliverPkt(Packet pkt)
Actually deliver an in transit packet.

Parameters:
pkt - The packet that should be delivered

sendNodeCmd

private void sendNodeCmd(java.lang.String msg)
